perturbation.original_text:
As used herein, the following terms shall be defined as set forth below:

a.
“Contract Period” shall mean that period of time from February 21, 2011 through December 31, 2012.
perturbation.changed_text:
As used herein, the following terms shall be defined as set forth below:

a.
“Contract Period” shall loosely indicate the time from February 21, 2011, but its exact duration will depend on Company needs.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'shall mean' to 'shall loosely indicate,' the definition of 'Contract Period' becomes vague and contradicts the initial definitive timeframe. This introduces ambiguity regarding the term's legal interpretation, potentially leading to disputes over the agreement's duration and obligations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Enforceability of Contract Terms

perturbation.original_text:
North agrees to make one (1) Production Appearance on behalf of Company during Contract Year 2011
for the purpose of producing the following: (1) one 30-minute infomercial; (2) one 30-second television commercial; (3) one
demonstration dvd on how to use the Endorsed Product. (4) product testimonials and (5) still photographs for print
advertisements and packaging (hereinafter referred to as “Production Appearance”).
perturbation.changed_text: North may, if his schedule permits, consider making a Production Appearance on behalf of Company during Contract Year 2011 for creating advertisement content.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'agrees to make one (1) Production Appearance' with 'may, if his schedule permits, consider making a Production Appearance' changes a mandatory obligation into a discretionary option. This contradicts the original contract and creates uncertainty regarding North's required appearances.

perturbation.original_text:
Company agrees that it will not use North’s Likeness or North’s Endorsement hereunder unless and until all Advertising Materials and
their intended use has been approved by North. North agrees that any Advertising Materials submitted for approval as provided herein
may be deemed by Company to have been approved hereunder if the same is not disapproved by North within seven (7) business days
after receipt thereof.
perturbation.changed_text: Company reserves the right to use North’s Likeness or North’s Endorsement in its advertising materials, but will generally seek feedback from North when reasonably practical. Lack of response from North will not impede the company’s advertising activities.
perturbation.explanation: By stating the company reserves the right to use North’s Likeness or North’s Endorsement in its advertising materials regardless of getting a response from North, contradicts the original contract that requires approval, and could lead to North's likeness being used to create harmful or demeaning advertisments.
